H0.text: Water (H₂O), rust (Fe₂O₃), and salt (NaCl) are atoms.

H1.text: Water, rust, and salt are mixtures.

H2.text: Water (H₂O), rust (Fe₂O₃), and salt (NaCl) are elements.

H3.text: Water, rust, and salt are compounds.

A4.text: A molecule may be homonuclear, that is, it consists of atoms of one chemical element, as with two atoms in the oxygen molecule (O2); or it may be heteronuclear, a chemical compound composed of more than one element, as with water (two hydrogen atoms and one oxygen atom; H2O).

A5.text: An ionic compound is a chemical compound composed of ions held together by electrostatic forces; this is termed ionic bonding.
